item.title: I Can’t Stop Noticing Eye Floaters
item.description:
You blink, and there it is.
You move your eyes — still there.
You try to focus — and now it’s all you can see.

If you’ve said to yourself,

“I can’t stop noticing eye floaters,”
You are not alone — and you’re not broken.

This post is for anyone who feels like they’re trapped inside their own vision.

Why You Keep Noticing Them (and Why It’s Not Your Fault)

Here’s the hard truth:
The more you look for floaters, the more your brain learns to find them.

item.title: How I Finally Stopped Obsessing Over Eye Floaters
item.description:
I remember the exact moment I cracked.
It wasn’t dramatic. It was quiet.

Just me. Sitting on the edge of my bed.
Staring at the wall. Watching the same little speck float across my vision — again.

And I thought:

“I can’t do this for the rest of my life.”

That was the day I finally admitted: I wasn’t just noticing floaters — I was obsessed.

This post is the story of how I stopped spiraling…
And how you can too.
